response.original_title: Há Sempre Alguém Que Te Ama
response.overview: Filmed immediately after the end of the civil war in Angola, Há Sempre Alguém Que Te Ama records the return of Pocas Pascoal to the country where she was born, in an attempt to reconstruct the episode that, in 1975, led to the capture of the director along with her mother and sisters. An intimate documentary about memory and self-(re)construction.
response.tagline: In post civil war Angola, a filmmaker connects with her families experiences of the war and sisterhood.
response.title: Há Sempre Alguém Que Te Ama
